issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: The problem described is an issue which will never be fixed.
resolution.name: Won't Fix

fields.summary: Starting multiple instances results in public IP assignment failure

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
After starting 5 m2.2xlarge instances, I terminated them prior reaching the "running" state. While looking at the CC logs, I noticed that, while in teardown state, 4 instances have released their public IPs but one kept reporting being aware of the public IP:

{noformat}
2014-01-22 09:42:10 DEBUG 000005893 refresh_instances        | describing instance i-B5194713, Teardown, 0
2014-01-22 09:42:10 DEBUG 000005893 refresh_instances        | storing instance state: i-B5194713/Teardown/0.0.0.0/172.26.217.105
2014-01-22 09:42:10 DEBUG 000005893 print_ccInstance         | refresh_instances():  instanceId=i-B5194713 reservationId=r-86873C63 state=Teardown accountId=274222322256 ownerId=AIDBWQ2NXBHFYDAF4GQPM ts=1390412402 keyName=ssh-rsa  274222322256@eucalyptus.chuck ccnet={privateIp=172.26.217.105 publicIp=0.0.0.0 privateMac=D0:0D:B5:19:47:13 vlan=615 networkIndex=41} ccvm={cores=2 mem=4096 disk=30} ncHostIdx=4 serviceTag=http://10.111.5.76:8775/axis2/services/EucalyptusNC userData= launchIndex=4 platform=linux bundleTaskStateName=none, volumesSize=0 volumes={} groupNames={274222322256-0f8a7daf-d67c-4deb-9677-1afaf79e4009 } migration_state=none guestStateName=poweredOff
2014-01-22 09:42:10 DEBUG 000005895 refresh_instances        | describing instance i-B75A3DF6, Teardown, 0
2014-01-22 09:42:10 DEBUG 000005895 refresh_instances        | storing instance state: i-B75A3DF6/Teardown/128.0.1.102/172.26.217.101
2014-01-22 09:42:10 DEBUG 000005895 print_ccInstance         | refresh_instances():  instanceId=i-B75A3DF6 reservationId=r-86873C63 state=Teardown accountId=274222322256 ownerId=AIDBWQ2NXBHFYDAF4GQPM ts=1390412402 keyName=ssh-rsa  274222322256@eucalyptus.chuck ccnet={privateIp=172.26.217.101 publicIp=128.0.1.102 privateMac=D0:0D:B7:5A:3D:F6 vlan=615 networkIndex=37} ccvm={cores=2 mem=4096 disk=30} ncHostIdx=5 serviceTag=http://10.111.5.77:8775/axis2/services/EucalyptusNC userData= launchIndex=1 platform=linux bundleTaskStateName=none, volumesSize=0 volumes={} groupNames={274222322256-0f8a7daf-d67c-4deb-9677-1afaf79e4009 } migration_state=none guestStateName=poweredOff
{noformat}

Looking at the CLC, the address was released?
{noformat}
[root@d-01 ~]# euca-describe-addresses verbose | grep 128.0.1.102
ADDRESS	128.0.1.102	nobody	standard				
[root@d-01 ~]# 

[root@d-01 ~]# euca-describe-instances 
[root@d-01 ~]# 
{noformat}

And the CC reported being aware of the public IP until it got rid of this instance later:
{noformat}
2014-01-22 09:48:03 DEBUG 000001725 doDescribeInstances      | instances summary: instanceId=i-B75A3DF6, state=Teardown, migration_state=none, publicIp=128.0.1.102, privateIp=172.26.217.101
{noformat}

I will attach CLC/CC logs shortly
fields.summary: CLC/CC do not release Public IP properly

comments.body: Attached both CLC and CC logs.

I wasn't able to reproduce consistently but while starting 48 m1.small instances and terminating them after they reached "running" then I noticed a single instance on the CC where the Public IP remained until the CC got entirely rid of the instance but the CLC reported the IP being cleared.

Was able to reproduce this issue. From a clean startup of CC, I can start and stop 48 instances without a problem. On the second round of start/stop, one or more instances will hold their public IP assignment on teardown on the CC. Attaching SOS report where the issue occurred for instance i-434d4a15.

{noformat}
2014-03-20 16:13:35 DEBUG 000020425 doDescribeInstances      | instances summary: instanceId=i-8c3aff15, state=Teardown, migration_state=none, publicIp=0.0.0.0, privateIp=1.117.220.148

Attaching the CLC sos report as well.

Ok,

I tried to launch 48 more instances when that IP is in this state and I was able to see it being re-assigned on the CC to the new instances that is supposed to use it. I will review the logs to see if any failure occurred with the un-assignment and see if we should correct the behavior. But this is definitely not a critical issue anymore since it does not impact functionality.
Setting to major until I find the root cause of this issue (in case some other bad juju could happen).

From the logs I got:
{noformat}
2014-03-20 16:09:15  INFO 000018046 doUnassignAddress        | unassigning address 192.168.254.124
2014-03-20 16:09:15 DEBUG 000018046 doUnassignAddress        | invoked: userId=eucalyptus, src=192.168.254.124, dst=1.117.220.189

2014-03-20 16:09:16 DEBUG 000018046 pubIpSet                 | pubIpSet(): set: 192.168.254.124/0.0.0.0
2014-03-20 16:09:16 DEBUG 000032009 refresh_instances        | storing instance state: i-434d4a15/Extant/192.168.254.124/1.117.220.189
2014-03-20 16:09:16 DEBUG 000032009 print_ccInstance         | refresh_instances():  instanceId=i-434d4a15 reservationId=r-83c21780 state=Extant accountId=076684548757 ownerId=AIDMZMD317U2FNRHCWO2I ts=1395356902 keyName=ssh-rsa  076684548757@eucalyptus.chuck ccnet={privateIp=1.117.220.189 publicIp=192.168.254.124 privateMac=D0:0D:43:4D:4A:15 vlan=628 networkIndex=61} ccvm={cores=1 mem=256 disk=5} ncHostIdx=0 serviceTag=http://10.111.1.125:8775/axis2/services/EucalyptusNC userData= launchIndex=32 platform=linux bundleTaskStateName=none, volumesSize=0 volumes={} groupNames={076684548757-17397c88-5147-453e-bf44-9bb325ea3b0b } migration_state=none guestStateName=poweredOn

{noformat}

So it looks like the IP unassignment completed but somehow, the instance structure kept a reference to it?!
